meanings.definition: To recover or regain possession of something by legal means.
meanings.sent1: She replevied her stolen bike from the thief with the help of the police.
meanings.sent2: The company replevied their documents after the court order.
meanings.sent3: The detective replevied the missing necklace from the suspect's pocket.
meanings.sent4: The student replevied his lost pencil from the depths of his backpack.
meanings.sent5: The farmer replevied his lost sheep from the neighboring field.

meanings.definition: To take back or seize property as security for a debt.
meanings.sent1: The bank replevied the car when the loan was not repaid on time.
meanings.sent2: The landlord replevied the furniture when the tenant failed to pay rent.
meanings.sent3: The pawnshop replevied the jewelry as collateral for the loan.
meanings.sent4: The creditor replevied the electronics until the debt was settled.
meanings.sent5: The lender replevied the house due to non-payment of the mortgage.

meanings.definition: The act of replevying or reclaiming property.
meanings.sent1: The replevy of the stolen goods was a success for the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The replevy of the artwork brought relief to the museum staff.
meanings.sent3: The replevy of the antique vase was a topic of discussion among collectors.
meanings.sent4: The replevy of the lost items was a joyful event for the owner.
meanings.sent5: The replevy of the stolen car was a significant achievement for the police department.
